meanings.definition: The act of branching out or spreading apart
meanings.sent1: The divarications of the tree branches created a beautiful canopy.
meanings.sent2: The divarications of the river tributaries formed a complex network.
meanings.sent3: The divarications in the road led to a confusing detour.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts took unexpected divarications, leading to new insights.
meanings.sent5: The divarications of the roots grasped the earth firmly.

meanings.definition: A divergence or separation in direction or opinion
meanings.sent1: The divarications in their beliefs caused a rift in the group.
meanings.sent2: The divarications in their paths led them to different destinations.
meanings.sent3: Their divarications on the movie's ending sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The divarications in their goals made collaboration challenging.
meanings.sent5: The divarications in their viewpoints highlighted their individuality.
